description:
Rinko, a junior high school student, becomes a partner with Ruby, a rabbit Jewelpet, to find the Jewel Charms that were accidentally dropped from Jewel Land and got lost in the world of humans.

Since Jewel Charms appear around people in trouble, Rinko and Ruby always get involved in helping them solve their problems. With help from their friends and a good-looking high-level goverment official, they use the magic of Jewelpets to overcome obstacles, and in each episode they find another missing Jewelpet. Meanwhile, Black Cat Diana manipulates a group of petty criminals as she plans something evil to Jewel Land, the homeland of the Jewelpets.

(Source: AniDB)

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Acting
tags.description: Centers around actors or the acting industry.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Elf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an elf.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Fencing
tags.description: Centers around the sport of fencing.

node.description:
__Height:__ 153 cm

Mitsuko Horie is a Japanese seiyuu and singer. She was born in Yamato, Kanagawa, Japan. She is most known to American anime fans as the voice of Sailor Galaxia, but in all Latin-America she is know as the "Candy-Candy" opening theme singer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/cher_vOwO)

__Cher Watanabe__ is a Japanese musician, composer, arranger and keyboardist.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/cher_vOwO)

__Cher Watanabe__ is a Japanese musician, composer, arranger and keyboardist.

He is an animator and character designer. Motohashi started working at Studio Z. Later, after leaving Studio Z, he started together with Hirayama Satoshi and Kamegaki Hajime Studio Z5. Today he is affiliated with Xebec and is the representative director of its subsidiary Xebec M2.

An Italian singer and actress. She sings for television and animation series, and has recorded numerous albums, selling nearly 7 million copies. In Italy, she is also known for singing the Italian version of the theme song of many anime, including One Piece, Doraemon, Attacker YOU! ("Mila e Shiro" in Italian), Sailor Moon and Captain Tsubasa ("Holly e Benji" in Italian).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B3%B6%E5%B4%8E%E5%A5%88%E3%80%85%E5%AD%90)

Nanako Shimazaki is a director, animator and storyboard artist.

An Italian voice actor, ADR director and dialogue writer, mostly known for his roles as [Roronoa Zoro](https://anilist.co/character/62/), [Artificial Human No. 17](https://anilist.co/character/2147/), adult [Son Goten](https://anilist.co/character/2551/), [Kabuto Yakushi](https://anilist.co/character/2405/), [Judai Yuki](https://anilist.co/character/1300/), [Guts](https://anilist.co/character/422/) and [Keroro](https://anilist.co/character/1245/).

__Birthplace:__ Yokohama, Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan
__Daughter:__ [Ryouko Maekawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120430)

__Atsushi Maekawa__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter for anime, while he also occasionally writes lyrics for music.

__Birthplace:__ Yokohama, Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan
__Daughter:__ [Ryouko Maekawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120430)

__Atsushi Maekawa__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter for anime, while he also occasionally writes lyrics for music.
